channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Trump sacked Copyright Office director a day after she refused to rubber-stamp Musk’s plan to train AI models, top Dem says

item.title: Ozempic Comes for the Group Dinner
item.description: As the use of GLP-1s soars in popularity, diners are wrestling with new restaurant etiquette dilemmas — and adjusting accordingly.

item.title: REI’s new CEO started her tenure by apologizing for the brand’s endorsement of Trump’s interior secretary: ‘Our public lands are under attack’
item.description: Athleta's former CEO Mary Beth Laughton started her CEO tenure at REI on March 31.

item.title: HR departments are in the throes of an AI confidence crisis—here’s what’s holding teams back from better tech integration
item.description: Top human resources leaders are not confident that they’re getting the best results from their tech.

item.title: Kurdish P.K.K. Says It Will End Conflict with Turkish State
item.description: The Kurdistan Workers’ Party, or P.K.K., said that it would lay down its arms and disband, a decision that could reverberate in neighboring countries.

item.title: Newsom Asks Cities to Ban Homeless Encampments, Escalating Crackdown
item.description: “There are no more excuses,” the California governor said in pushing for municipalities to address one of the most visible byproducts of homelessness.

item.title: Stocks rally on China tariff deal, surging over 1,000 points at open
item.description: Trump administration still in negative territory, but just barely.

item.title: Trump Heads to the Middle East Focused on Business Deals, Not Diplomacy

item.title: Work-Bench’s new $160 million venture fund doubles down on New York enterprise tech investing
item.description: Why a 12-year bet on the New York tech ecosystem is paying off.

item.title: E.U. Leaders Demand Russia Accept Ukraine Cease-fire by End of Day
item.description: The Kremlin brushed off the threat of further sanctions, saying that “the language of ultimatums is unacceptable.”

item.title: Who Is Edan Alexander, the American Hostage Held by Hamas in Gaza?
item.description: Hamas said it would release the American Israeli national, who was serving in the Israeli Army when he was captured on Oct. 7, 2023.

item.description: The Kurdistan Workers’ Party, or P.K.K., said that it would lay down its arms and disband, a decision that could reverberate in neighboring countries.
